libshapedraw.primitive
Class Vector3

java.lang.Object
  libshapedraw.primitive.Vector3
All Implemented Interfaces:
Animates<ReadonlyVector3>, ReadonlyVector3
public class Vector3
extends Object
implements ReadonlyVector3, Animates<ReadonlyVector3>

Yet another class representing a (X, Y, Z) vector or coordinate 3-tuple.

All modifiers support method chaining, e.g. Vector3 result = new Vector3(2.0, 99.0, 0.0).setY(1.0).addZ(1.0).scaleX(0.5);

equals

@Deprecated
public boolean equals(Object other)
Deprecated. 

Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Equivalent to ReadonlyVector3.equalsExact(ReadonlyVector3).

This method is marked as deprecated because it's better practice to explicitly state margins of error for floating-point comparisons. For a non-zero margin of error, use ReadonlyVector3.equals(ReadonlyVector3, double).

public double lengthSquared()
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Equivalent to distanceSquared(Vector3.ZEROS).

Specified by:
lengthSquared in interface ReadonlyVector3
Returns:
the vector's length (aka magnitude) squared. To compare two two vectors' lengths, use this method instead of ReadonlyVector3.length() as it avoids the relatively expensive sqrt call.

the distance between two points, squared. If you're trying to compare two distances, use this method instead of ReadonlyVector3.distance(libshapedraw.primitive.ReadonlyVector3) as it avoids the relatively expensive sqrt call.

glApplyRotateDegrees

public void glApplyRotateDegrees(double angleDegrees)
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glRotated(angleDegrees, v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

Calling this method on a zero vector is a no-op.

"Un-applying" the rotation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

Specified by:
glApplyRotateDegrees in interface ReadonlyVector3

glApplyRotateRadians

public void glApplyRotateRadians(double angleRadians)
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glRotated(angleRadians*180.0/Math.PI, v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

Calling this method on a zero vector is a no-op.

"Un-applying" the rotation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

Specified by:
glApplyRotateRadians in interface ReadonlyVector3

glApplyScale

public void glApplyScale()
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glScaled(v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

"Un-applying" the scaling (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

Specified by:
glApplyScale in interface ReadonlyVector3

glApplyTranslate

public void glApplyTranslate()
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyVector3
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glTranslated(v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

"Un-applying" the translation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

Specified by:

swapComponents

public Vector3 swapComponents()
Swap the components of this vector: set y to the previous x value, z to y, and x to z. To swap in the other direction, simply call this method twice.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

truncate

public Vector3 truncate()
Drop the fractional portion of each component by casting each to an int, then back to a double. Values move closer to zero.

E.g.: -3.25 to -3.0; -0.6 to 0.0; 0.4 to 0.0; 5.3 to 5.0.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

floor

public Vector3 floor()
Drop the fractional portion of each component using Math.floor(double). Values move closer to negative infinity.

E.g.: -3.25 to -4.0; -0.6 to -1.0; 0.4 to 0.0; 5.3 to 5.0.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

ceiling

public Vector3 ceiling()
Drop the fractional portion of each component using Math.ceil(double). Values move closer to positive infinity.

E.g.: -3.25 to -3.0; -0.6 to 0.0; 0.4 to 1.0; 5.3 to 6.0.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

round

public Vector3 round()
Drop the fractional portion of each component using Math.round(float). Values move to the closest whole number.

E.g.: -3.25 to -3.0; -0.6 to -1.0; 0.4 to 0.0; 5.3 to 5.0.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

midpoint

public Vector3 midpoint(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Set this vector to the midpoint in between it and another vector. Equivalent to interpolate(other, 0.5).

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

interpolate

public Vector3 interpolate(ReadonlyVector3 other,
                           double alpha)
Set this vector to a point along the line between it and another vector. E.g., 0.0 is this vector; 0.5 is halfway between this vector and the other; 1.0 is the other vector.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

cross

public Vector3 cross(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Set this vector to the cross product between this vector and another.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

normalize

public Vector3 normalize()
Convert this vector to a unit vector. I.e., a length of 1 but still facing in the same direction. If the vector is all zeros, it is left unchanged.

Returns:
the same vector object, modified in-place.

animateStop

public Vector3 animateStop()
Description copied from interface: Animates
If there is an active animation changing this object's properties, stop it abruptly, leaving things in an intermediate state.

After calling this method it is safe to use other methods to modify the properties without being overwritten by the animation.

Specified by:
animateStop in interface Animates<ReadonlyVector3>
Returns:
the same object, modified in-place.

animateStart

public Vector3 animateStart(ReadonlyVector3 toVector,
                            long durationMs)
Description copied from interface: Animates
Start a finite animation on this object's properties, gradually changing them to match the specified properties over the specified interval.

After starting an animation, using any other method that modifies the properties is a bad idea, as the animation will be frequently overwriting them. Either wait for the animation to complete or use Animates.animateStop() to halt the animation early.

Specified by:
animateStart in interface Animates<ReadonlyVector3>
Parameters:
toVector - the properties to gradually change to.
durationMs - interval in milliseconds, >= 0.
Returns:
the same object, modified in-place.

animateStart

public Vector3 animateStart(double toX,
                            double toY,
                            double toZ,
                            long durationMs)
Convenience method, equivalent to animateStart(new Vector3(toX, toY, toZ), durationMs)

animateStartLoop

public Vector3 animateStartLoop(ReadonlyVector3 toVector,
                                boolean reverse,
                                long durationMs)
Description copied from interface: Animates
Start a looping animating this object's properties, gradually changing them to match the specified properties over the specified interval.

The animation loops indefinitely, going back and forth between the original properties and the specified properties.

After starting an animation, using any other method that modifies the properties is a bad idea, as the animation will be frequently overwriting them. Use Animates.animateStop() to halt the animation first.

Specified by:
animateStartLoop in interface Animates<ReadonlyVector3>
Parameters:
toVector - the properties to gradually change to.
reverse - if true, fade back to the original properties each time the animation loops. If false, jump directly back to the original properties each time.
durationMs - interval in milliseconds of each cycle, >= 0.
Returns:
the same object, modified in-place.

animateStartLoop

public Vector3 animateStartLoop(double toX,
                                double toY,
                                double toZ,
                                boolean reverse,
                                long durationMs)
Convenience method, equivalent to animateStartLoop(new Vector3(toX, toY, toZ), reverse, durationMs)
